doc:
Fernando Sancho https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fernando_Sancho 0 Fernando Sancho Les (7 January 1916 – 31 July 1990) was a Spanish actor. He was born in Zaragoza, in Aragon, Spain, and died in Madrid after surgery. He was often typecast as a Mexican bandit in paella and spaghetti westerns, including The Big Gundown (directed by Sergio Sollima), A Pistol for Ringo and Return of Ringo (directed by Duccio Tessari), Arizona Colt (directed by Michele Lupo), Minnesota Clay (directed by Sergio Corbucci), and Sartana (directed by Gianfranco Parolini). Though (almost) always given the same role — a portly Mexican bandit chief — Sancho was a strong actor, and became one of the icons of these films. He also appeared in a number of Spanish horror movies in the 1960s and 1970s. One of the better known horror parts was the role of a corrupt small town mayor in El Ataque de los Muertos sin Ojos (a.k.a. Return of the Blind Dead), directed by Amando de Ossorio. Another notable horror film was Orloff and the Invisible Man (1971), directed by Pierre Chevalier and starring Howard Vernon, an unofficial continuation of the Dr. Orloff saga begun by Jess Franco in The Awful Dr. Orloff (1962). Sancho also turned up briefly in the epic Lawrence of Arabia playing the Turkish sergeant who arrests T. E. Lawrence in Deraa. He also appeared in five Greek war movies (1970-73). Three of them involved World War II (i.e., Battle of Crete, Greek Resistance, Fort Roupel) and the other ones the Greek War of Independence and the resistance of Souliotes against Ali Pasha. Sancho had a prolific career and remained active in film up to his death. He made larger than life characters his specialty, and was a similarly 'big' character off screen as well — popular both with audiences and with his fellow actors. Fernando_Sancho_Les ( 7_January_1916 – 31_July_1990 ) was a_Spanish_actor . He was_born in Zaragoza , in Aragon , Spain , and died in Madrid after surgery . He was often typecast as a_Mexican_bandit in paella_and_spaghetti_westerns , including The_Big_Gundown_( directed by Sergio_Sollima_) , A_Pistol for Ringo_and_Return of Ringo_( directed by Duccio_Tessari_) , Arizona_Colt_( directed by Michele_Lupo_) , Minnesota_Clay (_directed by Sergio_Corbucci_) , and Sartana_( directed by Gianfranco_Parolini_) . Though_( almost )_always_given the_same_role — a_portly_Mexican_bandit_chief — Sancho was a_strong_actor , and became one of the_icons of these_films . He also appeared in a_number of Spanish_horror_movies in the_1960s_and_1970s . One of the_better_known_horror_parts was the_role of a_corrupt_small_town_mayor in El_Ataque de los_Muertos_sin_Ojos_(_a.k.a._Return of the_Blind_Dead_) , directed by Amando de Ossorio . Another_notable_horror_film was Orloff and the_Invisible_Man ( 1971_) , directed by Pierre_Chevalier and starring Howard_Vernon , an_unofficial_continuation of the_Dr._Orloff_saga begun by Jess_Franco in The_Awful_Dr._Orloff ( 1962_) . Sancho also turned up briefly in the_epic Lawrence of Arabia playing the_Turkish_sergeant who arrests T._E._Lawrence in Deraa . He also appeared in five_Greek_war_movies ( 1970-73_) . Three of them involved World_War_II_(_i.e. , Battle of Crete , Greek_Resistance , Fort_Roupel_) and the_other_ones the_Greek_War of Independence and the_resistance of Souliotes against Ali_Pasha . Sancho had a_prolific_career and remained active in film up to his_death . He made larger_than_life_characters his_specialty , and was a_similarly_'_big_'_character off screen as_well — popular both with audiences and with his_fellow_actors .
